segments.text: I feel a sense of fear watching the water overflow from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just drying dishes, completely unaware of the growing puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the children trying to get cookies, and it makes me nervous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is standing on that stool, and it looks like it could tip over any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the girl is encouraging him, and it's making me even more anxious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is pouring onto the floor, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I need to do something, to warn them, but I know I can't.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so calm, it's a stark contrast to the tension I feel inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long it will take for someone to notice the water or the kids' mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think someone is going to get hurt if they don't pay attention soon.
segments.speaker: PAR
